docs.lead_paragraph: Retiring to sunnier shores often sounds lovely, but the reality is that, depending on where you go, it can be tricky to get access to quality coverage.

headline.main: The Dream of Moving Abroad in Later Life, With Good Health Care
headline.print_headline: The Dream of Moving Abroad in Later Life, With Good Health Care

docs.abstract: Many older Americans who fantasize about retiring abroad find that it can be difficult to get access to affordable health insurance for quality care when they relocate.
docs.snippet: Retiring to sunnier shores often sounds lovely, but the reality is that, depending on where you go, it can be tricky to get access to quality coverage.

docs.lead_paragraph: Democrats are coalescing around Alison Lundergan Grimes, Kentucky’s secretary of state, who is seeking to unseat Mitch McConnell, the Senate minority leader.

headline.main: Kentucky Challenger Sets Sights on Senate G.O.P. Heavyweight
headline.print_headline: Kentucky Challenger Sets Sights on Senate G.O.P. Heavyweight

docs.abstract: Democrats are coalescing around Alison Lundergan Grimes, Kentucky’s secretary of state, in her bid to become her state's first female senator, and unseat Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell; McConnell is deeply unpopular at home but he practically built the Republican Party in Kentucky and has spent decades reminding voters of federal dollars he has brought home.
docs.snippet: Democrats are coalescing around Alison Lundergan Grimes, Kentucky’s secretary of state, who is seeking to unseat Mitch McConnell, the Senate minority leader.

docs.lead_paragraph: The city presented its bankruptcy judge with the first official road map to its future: a plan for settling its debt and making Detroit livable again.

headline.main: Detroit Outlines Map to Solvency, Stressing Repair
headline.print_headline: Detroit Outlines Map to Solvency, Stressing Repair

docs.abstract: Detroit presents federal judge with first official road map for its financial future seven months after entering bankruptcy; proposal, designed to pay off more than 100,000 creditors and create budget for basic community services, envisions tearing down tens of thousands of blighted buildings while lowering income and property tax rates; largely avoids complex political, financial and social issues that critics warn will hinder timetable for emerging from bankruptcy.
docs.snippet: The city presented its bankruptcy judge with the first official road map to its future: a plan for settling its debt and making Detroit livable again.

byline.contributor: Monica Davey reported from Detroit, and Mary Williams Walsh from New York.
byline.original: By MONICA DAVEY and MARY WILLIAMS WALSH
